Functions

template<class T>
ArrayIndex & whereGT (ArrayIndex &index, Array< T > &vec, const T &thresh)
 Adds the indices of all elements of array "vec" that are greater than the given "thresh" to the index array "index" and returns this index array.
template<class T>
ArrayIndex & whereGE (ArrayIndex &index, Array< T > &vec, const T &thresh)
 Adds the indices of all elements of array "vec" that are greater than or equal to the given "thresh" to the index array "index" and returns this index array.
template<class T>
ArrayIndex & whereEQ (ArrayIndex &index, Array< T > &vec, const T &thresh)
 Adds the indices of all elements of array "vec" that are equal to the given "thresh" to the index array "index" and returns this index array.
template<class T>
ArrayIndex & whereNE (ArrayIndex &index, Array< T > &vec, const T &thresh)
 Adds the indices of all elements of array "vec" that are not equal to the given "thresh" to the index array "index" and returns this index array.
template<class T>
ArrayIndex & whereLT (ArrayIndex &index, Array< T > &vec, const T &thresh)
 Adds the indices of all elements of array "vec" that are less than the given "thresh" to the index array "index" and returns this index array.
template<class T>
ArrayIndex & whereLE (ArrayIndex &index, Array< T > &vec, const T &thresh)
 Adds the indices of all elements of array "vec" that are less than or equal to the given "thresh" to the index array "index" and returns this index array.
ArrayIndex operator && (ArrayIndex &a, ArrayIndex &b)
 Given two index arrays "a" and "b", where the indices are stored in ascending order, an index array with all indices stored in "a" AND "b" is returned.
ArrayIndex operator|| (ArrayIndex &a, ArrayIndex &b)
 Given two index arrays "a" and "b", where the indices are stored in ascending order, an index array with all indices stored in "a" OR "b" is returned.
template<class T1, class T2>
void copy (Array< T1 > &dst, const Array< T2 > &src, const ArrayIndex &index)
 Copies all elements of "src", whose indices are stored in index array "index" to the array "dst".
std::ostream & operator<< (std::ostream &os, const ArrayIndex &a)
 Writes the content of index array "a" to the output stream "os".
bool operator== (const ArrayIndex &v, const ArrayIndex &w)
 Returns "true" if the index arrays "v" and "w" are equal.
bool operator!= (const ArrayIndex &v, const ArrayIndex &w)
 Returns "true" if the index arrays "v" and "w" are not equal.

Detailed Description

Offers some operations for the index arrays defined in class ArrayIndex.

Here you will find operations for

  • extracting indices of array elements, that fulfill a comparison to a given thresh value
  • combining index arrays with AND and OR
  • copying array elements indicated by an index array to another array
  • testing index arrays for equality and inequality
  • output of index arrays
